cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles south of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, skirting the North Carolina coast tonight then moving just east of southeastern Virginia on Friday before heading toward New England and Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of North Carolina (near Cape Fear/Cape Lookout)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning; Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Warning remains south of the NC/VA border; no watches in Virginia portion of coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from NC/VA border to Fenwick Island DE, including lower Chesapeake Bay; Storm Surge Warning Duck NC to Poquoson VA including Hampton Roads
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern Virginia and the lower Chesapeake Bay coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds with gusts 45–55 mph possible Friday; low (4%) chance of 50-kt sustained winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft possible in Hampton Roads and lower Chesapeake Bay Friday during high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 3–8 inches causing flash-flood risk in far southeast Virginia
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Friday; dangerous surf and rip currents preceding the storm
